00036     template<class T>
00037     void PipeQueueConsumer<T>::keep(const T*t) {
00038         debug_pointer("keep(t):t= ", t);
00039         debug_vector("keep(): current", current);
00040         debug_pointer("keep(): last", lastObject);
00041         debug_vector("keep(): toKeep", toKeep);
00042 
00043         if (!ac_contains(current, t)) {
00044             debug_pointer("keep(): current does not contain this pointer: ", t);
00045         } else
00046         if(ac_contains(toKeep, t)) {
00047             debug_pointer("keep(): keep already contains this pointer: ", t);
00048         } else {
00049             toKeep.push_back(t);
00050         }
00051 
00052         debug_vector("keep() - after: toKeep", toKeep);
00053     }

00055     template<class T>
00056     vector<const T*> PipeQueueConsumer<T>::freeze() {
00057         debug_vector("freeze(): current", current);
00058         debug_pointer("freeze(): last", lastObject);
00059         debug_vector("freeze(): toKeep", toKeep);
00060 
00061         vector<const T*> newObjects = downloadNew();
00062 
00063         debug_vector("freeze(): newobjects", newObjects);
00064 
00065         if(newObjects.size()) {
00066             // se ci sono nuovi oggetti
00067 
00068             // vengono flushati, anche last, ma non quelli in keep
00069             vector<const T*> toFlush;
00070             for(size_t i=0;i<current.size();i++)
00071                 if( (!ac_contains(toKeep, current[i])) && (current[i]!=lastObject))
00072                     toFlush.push_back(current[i]);
00073 
00074             if(lastObject && (!ac_contains(toKeep,lastObject)) && (!ac_contains(toKeep,lastObject)))
00075                 toFlush.push_back(lastObject);
00076 
00077 
00078             debug_vector("freeze(): toFlush", toFlush);
00079 
00080             flushOld(toFlush);
00081 
00082 
00083             // il nuovo lastObjects è l'ultimo dei newObjects
00084             lastObject = newObjects[newObjects.size()-1];
00085 
00086         } else {
00087             // se non ci sono nuovi oggetti:
00088             // last non viene cambiato
00089             // vengono flushati tutti tranne last e quelli in keep
00090             vector<const T*> toFlush;
00091             for(size_t i=0;i<current.size();i++)
00092                 if( (!ac_contains(toKeep, current[i])) && (current[i]!=lastObject))
00093                     toFlush.push_back(current[i]);
00094 
00095             debug_vector("freeze(): toFlush", toFlush);
00096 
00097             flushOld(toFlush);
00098 
00099         }
00100 
00101         // il nuovo current è keep + newObjects
00102         current = toKeep;
00103         for(size_t i=0;i<newObjects.size();i++)
00104             if (!ac_contains(current, newObjects[i])) current.push_back(newObjects[i]);
00105 
00106         // il nuovo keep è vuoto
00107         toKeep.clear();
00108 
00109         debug_vector("freeze() - after: current", current);
00110         debug_pointer("freeze() - after: last", lastObject);
00111         debug_vector("freeze() - after: toKeep", toKeep);
00112 
00113 
00114         return current;
00115     }

00126     template<class T>
00127     void PipeQueueConsumer<T>::flushOld(const vector<const T*>&v) {
00128         debug_vector("flushOld(): toFlush", v);
00129         debug_deque("flushOld(): pipe_buffer", pipe_buffer);
00130         for(size_t i=0;i<v.size();++i)
00131             pipe_buffer.push_back(v[i]);
00132 
00133         debug_deque("flushOld(): pipe_buffer before flushPipeBuffer ", pipe_buffer);
00134         flushPipeBuffer();
00135         debug_deque("flushOld(): pipe_buffer after flushPipeBuffer ", pipe_buffer);
00136     }

00138     template<class T>
00139     void PipeQueueConsumer<T>::flushPipeBuffer() {
00140         // While we have stuff to send
00141         while( pipe_buffer.size() > 0 ) {
00142             // Consider the first in list
00143             const T * first = pipe_buffer.front();
00144             // Try to write
00145             if(!writePointer(fd_out, (void*)first)) {
00146                 // TODO: warn only after a certain size
00147                 // TODO: implement a callback to warn the thread?
00148                 cerr << this->name << ": My return pipe is full: current buffer size: " <<
00149                     pipe_buffer.size() << ". Do you call gc() on the master queue every once in a while?" << endl;
00150                 break;
00151             }
00152             // Okay, first is gone
00153             pipe_buffer.pop_front();
00154         }
00155     }

00157     template<class T>
00158     vector<const T*> PipeQueueConsumer<T>::downloadNew() {
00159         vector<const T*> v;
00160         void * p = 0;
00161         while(readPointer(fd_in,&p))
00162             if (!ac_contains(v, p)) v.push_back((const T*)p);
00163         return v;
00164     }

00168     template<class T>
00169     void PipeQueue<T>::
00170     setSignalSemaphore(PipeQueueConsumer<T>*c, PosixConstructs::PosixSemaphore* semaphore){
00171         mutex.lock(HERE);
00172             typename Con2sub::iterator i = subscriptions.find(c);
00173             if (i==subscriptions.end()) {
00174                 // error
00175             } else {
00176                 i->second.semaphore = semaphore;
00177             }
00178         mutex.unlock();
00179     }

00181     template<class T>
00182     bool PipeQueue<T>::
00183     hasSignalSemaphore(PipeQueueConsumer<T>*c) {
00184         bool ret = false;
00185         mutex.lock(HERE);
00186             typename Con2sub::iterator it = subscriptions.find(c);
00187             if (it == subscriptions.end()) {
00188                 // error
00189             }
00190             else {
00191                 ret = (it->second.semaphore != 0);
00192             }
00193         mutex.unlock();
00194         return ret;
00195     }

00210     template<class T>
00211     void PipeQueue<T>::deleteConsumer(PipeQueueConsumer<T>*c, Stack w) {
00212         mutex.lock(w+HERE);
00213             typename Con2sub::iterator i = subscriptions.find(c);
00214             if(i==subscriptions.end()) {
00215                 // error
00216             } else {
00217                 close(i->second.fd_in);
00218                 close(i->second.fd_out);
00219                 subscriptions.erase(i);
00220             }
00221         delete c;
00222         mutex.unlock();
00223     }

00226     template<class T>
00227     PipeQueueConsumer<T> *
00228     PipeQueue<T>::createConsumer(const std::string&name, Stack w) {
00229         mutex.lock(w+HERE);
00230             // From master to consumer
00231             struct { int read; int write; } m2c;
00232             int res = pipe((int*)&m2c);
00233             if(0!=res) { mutex.unlock(); return 0; }
00234 
00235             // From consumer to master
00236             struct { int read; int write; } c2m;
00237             res = pipe((int*)&c2m);
00238             if(0!=res) { mutex.unlock(); return 0; } // should deallocate other pipe
00239 
00240             if(PIPEQUEUE_NOT_BLOCKING) {
00241                 setNonBlocking(m2c.write);
00242                 setNonBlocking(c2m.write);
00243             }
00244 
00245             Subscription s;
00246                 s.fd_in = c2m.read;
00247                 s.fd_out = m2c.write;
00248                 s.interests = 0;
00249                 s.semaphore = 0;
00250                 s.name = name;
00251             string n = name + "(M=" + this->name + ")";
00252             PipeQueueConsumer<T>*c=new PipeQueueConsumer<T>(m2c.read,c2m.write,n);
00253             subscriptions[c]=s;
00254         mutex.unlock();
00255         return c;
00256     }

00258     template<class T>
00259     size_t PipeQueue<T>::push(T*ob, Stack w) {
00260             mutex.lock(w+HERE);
00261             if(ptr2ref.find(ob)!=ptr2ref.end()) {
00262                 logIt("ERROR!! pushing again");
00263                 mutex.unlock();
00264                 return 0;
00265             }           // first put in the buffers
00266             size_t copies = 0;
00267             for(typename Con2sub::iterator i=subscriptions.begin(); i!=subscriptions.end();++i)
00268                 if(! i->second.interests ||
00269                     i->second.interests->areYouInterested(ob))
00270                 {
00271                     copies++;
00272                     i->second.buffer.push_back(ob);
00273                 }
00274 
00275             if(copies) {
00276                 ptr2ref[ob] = copies;
00277             } else {
00278                 delete ob;
00279             }
00280 
00281             // then flush the buffers
00282             for(typename Con2sub::iterator i=subscriptions.begin(); i!=subscriptions.end();++i)
00283             {
00284                 std::deque<const T*> &buffer = i->second.buffer;
00285                 int fd_out = i->second.fd_out;
00286 
00287                 // While we have stuff to send
00288                 while( buffer.size() > 0 ) {
00289                     // Consider the first in list
00290                     const T * first = buffer.front();
00291                     // Try to write
00292                     if(!writePointer(fd_out, (void*)first)) {
00293                         // TODO: warn only after a certain size
00294                         // TODO: implement a callback to warn the thread?
00295                         cerr << this->name << ": This is not an error, but pay attention. "
00296                         "One pipe is full: " <<
00297                             i->second.name << " current buffer size: " <<
00298                             i->second.buffer.size() << endl;
00299                         break;
00300                     } else {
00301                         // Okay, first is gone
00302                         buffer.pop_front();
00303                         // Call the callback
00304                         push_callback(i->first);
00305                         // Signal the thread
00306                         if(i->second.semaphore)
00307                             i->second.semaphore->signal();
00308 
00309                     }
00310 
00311                 }
00312             }
00313 
00314         mutex.unlock();
00315         logIt(string("MASTER this=")+toString(this)+": pushed object "+
00316             toString(ob) + " with copies " + toString(copies));
00317 
00318         return copies;
00319     }

00321     template<class T>
00322     size_t  PipeQueue<T>::size() {
00323         mutex.lock(HERE);
00324         size_t s = ptr2ref.size();
00325         mutex.unlock();
00326         return s;
00327     }

00329     template<class T>
00330     void PipeQueue<T>::gc(Stack w) {
00331         mutex.lock(w+HERE);
00332         //T * ob = 0;
00333         void* ob = 0;
00334 
00335         int n=0;
00336         for(typename Con2sub::iterator i=subscriptions.begin(); i!=subscriptions.end();++i) {
00337             n++;
00338             while(readPointer(i->second.fd_in, /*(void**)*/&ob)) {
00339                 logIt(string("MASTER this=")+toString(this)+": gc from client "
00340                     + toString(n) + " read pointer " + toString(ob));
00341 
00342                 typename Ptr2ref::iterator j = ptr2ref.find((T*)ob);
00343                 if(j==ptr2ref.end()) {
00344                     logIt(string("MASTER this=")+toString(this)+": BUG error, pointer "+
00345                         toString(ob) + " is not present in ptr2ref");
00346 
00347                     for(typename Ptr2ref::iterator k=ptr2ref.begin();k!=ptr2ref.end();++k) {
00348                         logIt(string("  object ") + toString(k->first) +
00349                             " ref. = " + toString(k->second));
00350                     }
00351                 }
00352                 else {
00353                     if (ac_contains(i->first->toKeep, ob)) {
00354                         logIt(string("MASTER this=")+toString(this)+": trying to -- a kept object");
00355                     }
00356                     else j->second--;
00357 
00358                     logIt(string("MASTER this=")+toString(this)+": gc -- ref: "+toString(j->second)+
00359                             string(" obj=")+toString(ob));
00360 
00361                     if(0==j->second) {
00362                         logIt(string("MASTER this=")+toString(this)+": gc -- deleting "
00363                             +toString(ob));
00364                         ptr2ref.erase(j);
00365                         delete (T*) ob;
00366                     }
00367                 }
00368             }
00369         }
00370         mutex.unlock();
00371     }
